item.title: Jacinta Allan seeks suspension of CFMEU construction division from Victorian Labor party
item.description:
Comes after the union’s national executive put Victorian branch into administration over allegations of criminal links

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our morning and afternoon news emails, free app or daily news podcast

The Victorian branch of the CFMEU has been placed into administration, with Jacinta Allan seeking the suspension of the union’s construction division from the state Labor party over allegations of criminal links.

The Victorian premier on Monday said she has also written to police and the Independent Broad-based Anti-corruption Commission to investigate allegations of criminal links within the union, reported by Nine newspapers at the weekend.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s free morning and afternoon email newsletters for your daily news roundup

Continue reading...

item.title: Biden gives Oval Office address after shooting – as it happened
item.description:
Suspect, named as Thomas Matthew Crooks, killed in shooting at Pennsylvania rally; Trump and Biden reportedly had ‘good conversation’

  • Questions mount over shooter’s ability to access roof despite security presence
  • What we know about the suspected gunman

Before Saturday’s attempt on Donald Trump’s life, there have been multiple assassinations of US presidents.

Abraham Lincoln was the first president to be assassinated, shot by John Wilkes Booth on 14 April 1865, as he and his wife, Mary Todd Lincoln, attended a special performance of the comedy Our American Cousin at Ford’s Theatre in Washington, the AP writes.

Continue reading...

item.title: Thomas Matthew Crooks: What we know about the Trump attacker
